00030 /*
00031  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00032  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00033  *
00034  * lustre/tests/reads.c
00035  *
00036  * Lustre Reads test
00037  *
00038  * Author: Nikita Danilov <nikita@clusterfs.com>
00039  */
00040 
00041 #define _XOPEN_SOURCE 500 /* for pread(2) */
00042 
00043 #include <errno.h>
00044 #include <fcntl.h>
00045 #include <ctype.h>
00046 #include <unistd.h>
00047 #include <stdlib.h>
00048 #include <stdio.h>
00049 #include <string.h>
00050 
00051 #include <sys/types.h>
00052 #include <sys/time.h>
00053 
00054 static void usage(void)
00055 {
00056         printf("reads: read random or stride chunks of a file.\n");
00057         printf("Usage:\n\n");
00058         printf("reads -f <filename> -s <filesize> -b <buffersize>"
00059                "-a <adjacent reads> [-v] [-h] [-C] [-l <stride_length> ] "
00060                "[ -o <stride_offset> ] [-S <seed>] [-n <iterations>]"
00061                "[-w <width>] [-t <timelimit>]\n");
00062 }
00063 
00064 enum {
00065         BSIZE_DEFAULT = 16 * 4096
00066 };
00067 
00068 #define LOG(level, ...)                         \
00069 ({                                              \
00070         if ((level) <= verbosity)               \
00071                 fprintf(stderr, __VA_ARGS__);   \
00072 })
00073 
00074 enum {
00075         LOG_CRIT,
00076         LOG_WARN,
00077         LOG_INFO,
00078         LOG_DEBUG
00079 };
00080 
00081 enum {
00082         RR_OK,
00083         RR_PARSE,
00084         RR_SET,
00085         RR_MALLOC,
00086         RR_OPEN,
00087         RR_PRECLEAN,
00088         RR_READ
00089 };
00090 
00091 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00092 {
00093         int    verbosity = LOG_CRIT;
00094         char  *fname = NULL;
00095         loff_t size = 0;
00096         size_t bsize = 0;
00097         int    ad = 1;
00098         int    preclean = 0;
00099         int    width = 10;
00100         unsigned int seed = 0;
00101         unsigned long iterations = 0;
00102         unsigned long timelimit = 24 * 3600;
00103         unsigned long stride_length = 0;
00104         unsigned long stride_offset = 0;
00105 
00106         int opt;
00107         int fd;
00108         unsigned long nblocks;
00109         unsigned long i;
00110         ssize_t  ret;
00111 
00112         struct timeval start;
00113         struct timeval stop;
00114 
00115         double usecs;
00116 
00117         char *buf;
00118         char *term;
00119 
00120         do {
00121                 opt = getopt(argc, argv, "f:s:b:va:hCS:n:t:l:o:w:");
00122                 switch (opt) {
00123                 case -1:
00124                         break;
00125                 default:
00126                         LOG(LOG_CRIT, "Unable to parse command line.\n");
00127                 case 'h':
00128                         usage();
00129                         return RR_PARSE;
00130                 case 'v':
00131                         verbosity ++;
00132                         break;
00133                 case 'f':
00134                         fname = strdup(optarg);
00135                         break;
00136                 case 's':
00137                         size = strtol(optarg, &term, 0);
00138                         if (term == optarg) {
00139                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse size %s\n", optarg);
00140                                 usage();
00141                                 return RR_SET;
00142                         }
00143                         break;
00144                 case 'b':
00145                         bsize = strtol(optarg, &term, 0);
00146                         if (term == optarg) {
00147                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse bsize %s\n", optarg);
00148                                 usage();
00149                                 return RR_SET;
00150                         }
00151                         break;
00152                 case 'a':
00153                         ad = (int)strtol(optarg, &term, 0);
00154                         if (term == optarg) {
00155                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse ad %s\n", optarg);
00156                                 usage();
00157                                 return RR_SET;
00158                         }
00159                         break;
00160                 case 'C':
00161                         preclean = 1;
00162                         break;
00163                 case 'S':
00164                         seed = strtol(optarg, &term, 0);
00165                         if (term == optarg) {
00166                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse seed %s\n", optarg);
00167                                 usage();
00168                                 return RR_SET;
00169                         }
00170                         break;
00171                 case 'n':
00172                         iterations = strtol(optarg, &term, 0);
00173                         if (term == optarg) {
00174                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse seed %s\n", optarg);
00175                                 usage();
00176                                 return RR_SET;
00177                         }
00178                         break;
00179 
00180                         break;
00181                 case 't':
00182                         timelimit = strtol(optarg, &term, 0);
00183                         if (term == optarg) {
00184                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse seed %s\n", optarg);
00185                                 usage();
00186                                 return RR_SET;
00187                         }
00188                         break;
00189                 case 'l':
00190                         stride_length = strtol(optarg, &term, 0);
00191                         if (term == optarg) {
00192                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse seed %s\n", optarg);
00193                                 usage();
00194                                 return RR_SET;
00195                         }
00196                         break;
00197                 case 'o':
00198                         stride_offset = strtol(optarg, &term, 0);
00199                         if (term == optarg) {
00200                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse seed %s\n", optarg);
00201                                 usage();
00202                                 return RR_SET;
00203                         }
00204                         break;
00205                 case 'w':
00206                         width = (int)strtol(optarg, &term, 0);
00207                         if (term == optarg) {
00208                                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse seed %s\n", optarg);
00209                                 usage();
00210                                 return RR_SET;
00211                         }
00212                         break;
00213                 }
00214         } while (opt != -1);
00215 
00216         if (fname == NULL || size == 0 || bsize == 0 || ad <= 0) {
00217                 usage();
00218                 return RR_SET;
00219         }
00220 
00221         bsize /= ad;
00222         nblocks = size / bsize;
00223         buf = malloc(bsize);
00224         if (buf == NULL) {
00225                 LOG(LOG_CRIT, "malloc(%lu) failure: %s\n", (long)bsize,
00226                     strerror(errno));
00227                 return RR_MALLOC;
00228         }
00229 
00230         fd = open(fname, (preclean ? O_RDWR : O_RDONLY) | O_CREAT, 0700);
00231         if (fd == -1) {
00232                 LOG(LOG_CRIT, "malloc(\"%s\") failure: %s\n", fname,
00233                     strerror(errno));
00234                 return RR_OPEN;
00235         }
00236         if (preclean) {
00237                 loff_t towrite;
00238                 size_t count;
00239 
00240                 LOG(LOG_INFO, "precleaning");
00241                 for (i = 0, towrite = size; towrite > 0; towrite -= ret) {
00242                         count = bsize < towrite ? bsize : towrite;
00243                         memset(buf, bsize, seed + i++);
00244                         ret = write(fd, buf, count);
00245                         if (ret < 0) {
00246                                 LOG(LOG_CRIT, "write() failure: %s\n",
00247                                     strerror(errno));
00248                                 close(fd);
00249                                 return RR_PRECLEAN;
00250                         }
00251                 }
00252         }
00253         if (seed != 0)
00254                 srand(seed);
00255         gettimeofday(&start, NULL);
00256         timelimit += start.tv_sec;
00257         for (i = 0; !iterations || i < iterations; i ++) {
00258                 unsigned long block_nr;
00259                 int j;
00260 
00261                 if (stride_length) 
00262                         block_nr = (unsigned long)(i*stride_length + 
00263                                                    stride_offset) % nblocks;
00264                 else
00265                         block_nr = (unsigned long)((double)nblocks*rand()/
00266                                                    (RAND_MAX+1.0));
00267                 if (i % width == 0)
00268                         LOG(LOG_INFO, "\n%9lu: ", i);
00269                 LOG(LOG_INFO, "%7lu ", block_nr);
00270                 for (j = 0; j < ad; j++) {
00271                         ret = pread(fd, buf, bsize, (block_nr + j) * bsize);
00272                         if (ret != bsize) {
00273                                 LOG(LOG_CRIT,
00274                                     "pread(...%zi, %li) got: %zi, %s\n", bsize,
00275                                     block_nr * bsize, ret, strerror(errno));
00276                                 close(fd);
00277                                 return RR_READ;
00278                         }
00279                 }
00280                 gettimeofday(&stop, NULL);
00281                 if (stop.tv_sec > timelimit)
00282                         break;
00283         }
00284         close(fd);
00285         usecs = (stop.tv_sec - start.tv_sec) * 1000000. +
00286                 stop.tv_usec - start.tv_usec;
00287         printf("\n%fs, %gMB/s\n", usecs / 1000000.,
00288                (double)bsize * ad * i / usecs);
00289         return RR_OK;
00290 }
